headline: Ex-President Bush backs two high-profile Republicans slammed by Trump
author: Max Greenwood
sentences: Cheney, who was one of 10 House Republicans to vote to impeach Trump last year in the wake of the Jan. 6, 2021, riot at the U.S. Capitol, raised more than $2 million in the last quarter of the year and entered 2022 with roughly $4.7 million in the bank.

According to Federal Election Commission filings, Bush funneled two separate donations of $2,900 to Cheney in late October  the maximum contribution an individual can give a candidate's campaign committee for both a primary and general election.
and Sen. Lisa Murkowski (R-Alaska) in the final months of 2021, a show of support for two of former President Trump's top Republican targets of the 2022 midterm elections.
Jeb Bush (R), gave $1,000 to Cheney's campaign in November, bringing his total contributions to the Wyoming Republican to $3,000 this cycle.
Murkowski pulled in nearly $1.4 million in the last quarter of 2021 and entered the new year nearly $4.3 million on hand.
Murkowski joined six of her Republican colleagues last year in voting to convict Trump in his second impeachment trial.
Bush also gave $2,900 to fuel Murkowski's primary campaign against her Trump-endorsed challenger, Kelly Tshibaka.
Former President George W. Bush gave money to the reelection campaigns of Rep. Liz Cheney (R-Wyo.)
By comparison, Tshibaka raised just over $600,000 and has about $634 in the bank.
She's the only GOP senator who did so who is facing reelection this year.
Bush isn't the only one in his family to donate.
